newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate inches up to 8.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate inches up to 8.6 pct.

text.p: Larger volumes of one-month kuna loans at higher rates on Monday pushed up the weighted price of money to 8.6 from 8.4 percent on Croatia's interbank market.
Dealers said demand for funds slackened to 18.9 million kuna with supply rising to 75 million. New loans totalled 13.8 million.
Interbank call money was flat at 8.0 percent with the 15-30 day rate at 10-12 percent.
Insurers' five-10 and 10-15 day funds were rolled over at a steady seven percent.
Due to stronger demand by banks on the weekend, a total of 171.3 million kuna were settled in overnight trade.

The National Bank of Croatia stayed out of the foreign exchange market. It calculated the kuna little changed at 5.3726 to the dollar and slightly weaker at 3.5559 to the mark. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
